Definition: The identifier of the observation unit (cross-referencing to Observation Unit worksheet) from which this sample was extracted.
The stage in the life of a plant structure during which the sample was taken, in the form of an accession number to a suitable controlled vocabulary (Plant Ontology, BBCH scale)
Format: Plant Ontology term (subclass of PO:0009012) or BBCH scale term

Definition: A description of  the plant part (e.g. leaf) or the plant product (e.g. resin) from which the sample was taken, in the form of an accession number to a suitable controlled vocabulary (Plant Ontology).
Any information not captured by the other sample fields, including quantification, sample treatments and processing.
Example: Distal part of the leaf ; 100 mg of roots taken from 10 roots at 20�C, conserved in vacuum at 20 mM NaCl salinity, stored at -60 �C to -85 �C.

Definition: The date and time when the sample was collected / harvested

An identifier for the sample in a persistent repository, comprising the name of the repository and the accession number of the observation unit therein. Submission to the EBI Biosamples repository is recommended. URI are recommended when possible.
